metadata.title: USN-6569-1 -- libclamunrar vulnerabilities
metadata.description: it was discovered that libclamunrar incorrectly handled directories when extracting RAR archives. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to overwrite arbitrary files and execute arbitrary code. This issue only affected Ubuntu 20.04 LTS, Ubuntu 22.04 LTS, and Ubuntu 23.04. (CVE-2022-30333)  It was discovered that libclamunrar incorrectly validated certain structures when extracting RAR archives. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code. (CVE-2023-40477)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6569-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  clamav-testfiles-rar - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.23.10.1 libclamunrar11 - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.23.10.1 libclamunrar - 1.0.4-0ubuntu0.23.10.1 No subscription required
